intro: Rubus × deltoideus f. intermedius, commonly known as the intermediate blackberry, is a hybrid plant that exhibits characteristics of both Rubus ursinus and Rubus pectoralis. It is a deciduous shrub with thorny stems and compound leaves that are typically trifoliate. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are usually dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ornamental and culinary purposes.
